question:
What will come in the place of question mark (?) in the following equation, if '+' and '-' are interchanged and '×' and '÷' are interchanged?
99 ÷ 9 - 999 × 9 + 99 = ?
solution:
(c) Given:- 99 ÷ 9 - 999 × 9 + 99
On interchanging signs as per instructions we get,
99 × 9 + 999 ÷ 9 - 99
= 891 + 111 - 99 = 903

question: What will be the day of the week on 08 June 2030 ?
solution:
(a)
Formula for calculating day of any date
0 = sunday, 1 = monday.... 6 = saturday
A = century code (4,2,0,6 for remainder 1,2,3,0) where remainder = dividing by first two digit of the year by 4
B = last two digits of year
C = number of leap years fallen in that century before that date.
D = month code (respective code of the months are 0, 3, 3, 6, 1, 4, 6, 2, 5, 0, 3, 5)
E = date
Day = remainder of (A + B + C + D + E) when divided by 7.
For 8 June 2030,
A = 6 B = 30 C = 7 D = 4 E = 8
According to formula,
Remainder of (A + B + C + D + E)/7 = 55/7
is 6 ⇒ Hence, 6 stands for Saturday.

solution: (b) As diabetes is caused by Sugar similarly Obesity is caused by Fat.

question:
Which two numbers (not individual digits) should be interchanged to make the given equation correct ?
56 + (11 × 2) - (52 ÷ 4) + 16 = 76
solution:
(b) Given :- 56 + (11 × 2) - (52 ÷ 4) + 16 = 76
After going through all the options, option (b) satisfies. After interchanging 56 and 52 we get
52 + (11 × 2) - (56 ÷ 4) + 16
52 + 22 - 14 + 16
74 + 2 = 76
L.H.S. = R.H.S.

question: Which mobile app was launched in September 2024 at the Indian Council of Agricultural Research-Central Institute of Freshwater Aquaculture (ICAR - CIFA) to address the needs of the ornamental fisheries sector?
solution: (d) Rangeen Machhli. On 12th September 2024, Union Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh alias Lalan Singh, launched the Rangeen Machhli mobile app at Indian Council of Agricultural Research-Central Institute of Freshwater Aquaculture (ICAR-CIFA), Bhubaneswar, Odisha.

question: Jaita is the main dance form of which state?
solution: (d) Uttar Pradesh. Jaita is a traditional folk dance performed by the Jat community, especially in the Bundelkhand region, during weddings and festivals. Other folk dances of Uttar Pradesh include: Nautanki, Raslila, Kajri. State with their folk dances: Rajasthan - Ghoomar, Suisini, kalbeliya, Chakri, Ganagor, Jhulan Leela. Madhya Pradesh - Phulpati, Jawara, Selalarki, Selabhadoni, Matki. Karnataka - Yakshagana, Lambi, Huttari, Kunitha, Suggi, Karga.

question: Who was the designer of India’s national flag?
solution: (c) Pingali Venkayya: He presented the original design of the Indian flag with red and green colors to Mahatma Gandhi in 1921. The National Flag was adopted by the Constituent Assembly of India on 22 July 1947. On August 22, 1907, Madam Bhikaji Cama became the first person to hoist the Indian flag on foreign soil in Stuttgart in Germany. B. N. Rau : Appointed Constitutional Adviser in 1946. K. M. Munshi : Described the Preamble as the "political horoscope" of the Constitution. He was also the first Chairman of the Order of Business Committee. Prem Behari Narain Raizada (Saxena): Hand-wrote the original Indian Constitution.

question: What is the defense allocation in the Union Budget FY2025-26?
solution: (b) ₹6.8 lakh crore. The budget emphasizes modernization, domestic procurement, and operational readiness, with ₹1.8 lakh crore allocated for new weapons and equipment.

question: ________ is the science and art of cultivating fruits, vegetables, flowers and ornamental plants.
solution: (d) Horticulture. Olericulture : Branch of horticulture that deals with the production, processing, and marketing of vegetables. Viniculture: The cultivation of grapes, specifically for wine production. Floriculture includes cultivation and production of all types of ornamentals, viz., croton, cacti, orchids, grasses and bamboos. Sericulture: The cultivation of silkworms for silk production.

question: Which Article of the Indian Constitution mentions that any person to become the President of India has to be a citizen of India?
solution: (a) Article 58 of the Indian Constitution states the qualifications for a person to be eligible for election as President of India, which includes being a citizen of India. Other articles: Article 57 - Eligibility for re-election. Article 59 - Conditions of the President's office. Article 60 - Oath or affirmation by the President.

question: Which of the following items has a high fibre content?
solution: (c) Whole grains are high in dietary fiber, which is beneficial for digestive health. They also provide various vitamins and minerals. Other foods and their minerals: Eggs: Protein-rich, but fiber-free. Fish: Rich in protein and omega-3 fatty acids. Milk: Rich in calcium and protein.

question: Select the correct statement about climax community.
option_1: It is an ecological community in which populations of plants or animals, which are very unstable and exist for very few times.
option_2: It is the very first community of the ecosystem.
option_3: It consists of only plant population that makes a new ecological system.
option_4: It is an ecological community in which populations of plants or animals remain stable and exist in balance with each other and their environment.
solution: (d) A climax community is the “endpoint” of succession within the context of a particular climate and geography. The climax community remains stable as long as the environment remains unchanged.

question: Geologically, which of the following physiographic divisions of India is supposed to be one of the most stable land blocks?
solution: (c) The Peninsular plateau is a tableland composed of the old crystalline, igneous and metamorphic rocks. This plateau consists of two broad divisions, namely, the Central Highlands and the Deccan Plateau. The part of the Peninsular plateau lying to the north of the Narmada river. The Indian desert lies towards the western margins of the Aravali Hills. It is an undulating sandy plain covered with sand dunes. The northern plain is formed of alluvial soil. The Himalayas, geologically young and structurally fold mountains stretch over the northern borders of India.

question: Which of the following is NOT among the commercial sources of energy?
solution: (c) Fuel wood. It is a non-commercial or traditional source of energy, primarily used for domestic purposes such as cooking and heating. Commercial sources of energy are typically: Fossil fuels (petroleum, coal, natural gas), Electricity (produced from a variety of energy sources), Hydropower (electricity generated from water resources).

question: Atmospheric temperature does NOT depend on _________.
solution: (a) salinity of oceans. Atmospheric temperature primarily depends on several factors: latitude, which influences the variation in solar radiation due to the Earth's tilt; altitude, where temperature decreases with increasing elevation; and distance from the sea, which creates differences between coastal and continental temperatures.

question: Who among the following was honored with the title of Khan-e-Khana during the reign of Akbar?
solution: (d) Bairam Khan. He was a renowned military commander and nobleman who served as Akbar's regent and advisor. Akbar was the third Mughal emperor, reigning from 1556 to 1605. His court was known for the "nine gems" or Navratnas, which included Birbal, Tansen, Abul Fazl, Faizi, Todar Mal, Raja Man Singh, Abdul Rahim Khan-I-Khana, Fakir Aziao-Din, and Mullah Do Piaza.

question: Rani Karnaa was awarded the Sangeet Natak Akademi (1996) for her contribution to _____ .
solution: (b) Kathak. Rani Karnaa also received the Padma Shri Award in 2014. She was trained by Pandit Narayan Prasad and Sunder Prasad of the Jaipur gharana and Pandit Shambhu Maharaj and Birju Maharaj of Lucknow gharanas. Some renowned Kathak dancers include Pandit Birju Maharaj, Lachu Maharaj, and Shovana Narayan.

question: Koderma Gaya Hazaribagh belt is known for the production of which of the following minerals?
solution: (b) Mica deposits are found on the northern edge of the Chota Nagpur Plateau, with the Koderma-Gaya-Hazaribagh belt in Jharkhand leading production. Major mica-producing regions include Gaya, Hazaribagh, Ajmer, Beawar, Bhilwara, Udaipur, Dungarpur, Banswara, and Nellore. The main mica-producing states are Jharkhand, Rajasthan, and Andhra Pradesh.

question: Who is credited with inventing the reflecting telescope?
solution: (a) Isaac Newton. In 1668, he devised a reflecting telescope. Instead of a lens, it used a single curved main mirror, together with a smaller flat mirror. Scientists and Discoveries: Johannes Kepler - The three laws of planetary motion; Christiaan Huygens - The Wave theory of light.

question: What is the growth rate of the population of India as per census 2011?
solution: (c) 0.1764. Population growth refers to the change in the number of people in a specific area over time, expressed as a percentage. The first census was initiated by British Viceroy Lord Mayo in 1872. The first synchronized census occurred in 1881. The 2011 Census, the 15th overall and 7th since Independence, had the slogan “Our Census, Our Future.”

question: Which of the following was discovered by GN Ramachandran?
solution: (d) Triple helical structure of collagen. G.N. Ramachandran, an Indian physicist, is renowned for his work that resulted in the creation of the Ramachandran plot, which aids in understanding peptide structure. The collagen triple helix, a right-handed super-coiled structure, consists of three parallel α-chains, each adopting a polyproline II helical conformation.

question: The Vienna Convention is related to ____________.
solution: (b) protection of ozone layer. The Vienna Convention multilateral environmental agreement was signed in 1985, came into effect in 1988, and achieved universal ratification by 2009. The primary goal of the Vienna Convention is to safeguard human health and the environment from the harmful effects caused by ozone layer depletion.

question: Which of the following is NOT considered a method of conservation of natural resources?
solution: (a) Extraction - A separation method that transfers a compound from one phase or solvent to another to isolate it from impurities or unreacted starting materials. Method of conservation of Natural Resources : Reforestation, Rainwater Harvesting, Treatment of Industrial Effluents, In-Situ conservation of Biodiversity, Ex-Situ conservation of Biodiversity, Sustainable development, Crop rotation, Contour ploughing, etc.

question: Select the INCORRECT combination of dance and its respective state of origin.
solution: (a) Sattriya – Himachal Pradesh. Sattriya is a classical Indian dance form that originated in the Vaishnava monasteries of Assam. Classical dances and their state of Origin : Bharatnatyam (Tamil Nadu) · Kathak (North India) · Kathakali (Kerala) · Kuchipudi (Andhra Pradesh), Mohiniyattam (Kerala), Odissi (Odisha), Sattriya (Assam).

question: In 1908 Khudiram Bose along with _________ was involved in throwing a bomb at a carriage believing it to be occupied by Kingsford, the then sitting judge of Muzaffarpur.
solution: (c) Prafulla Chaki was an Indian revolutionary associated with the Jugantar group of revolutionaries. Khudiram Bose was among the youngest martyrs of India's freedom struggle against the British. At just 15, he had joined Anushilan Samiti and took part in several revolutionary activities against the British Raj. He was executed on August 11, 1908, in Muzaffarpur jail in Bihar.

question: Industries of strategic and national importance are usually placed in the ________ sector.
solution: (a) Public sector enterprises are government/state controlled companies or corporations funded by governments. The private sector is the part of the economy that is not state-controlled and is run by individuals and companies for profit. Co-operative sector industries are operated and owned by the suppliers or producers of raw materials, workers or both. A Joint sector is a business or industry that is jointly owned, controlled, and managed by the government and private entrepreneurs.

question: Under which of the following Mughal emperors were the Marathas a major challenge to the sovereignty of the Mughals?
solution: (b) Aurangzeb (Reign : 1658-1707) - He was the sixth Mughal Emperor and also known as Zinda Pir (living saint), Fakir, and Darbesh. He gave the French permission to build a factory in Surat in 1667. He banned singing, dancing and playing musical instruments, and Kalma writings on coins. He reimposed Jizya and Pilgrim tax in 1679 and ended the celebration of Navroz.

question: Which of the following is NOT a poverty alleviation programme in India?
solution: (b) Namami Gange. India has implemented several poverty alleviation programs aimed at reducing poverty and improving living standards. Poverty alleviation programme in India: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (2005), Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (2015), National Rural Livelihood Mission (2011), Public Distribution System (PDS), Pradhan Mantri Garib Kalyan Yojana (2016).

question: Which state will host the 39th National Games in 2027 ?
solution: (b) Meghalaya. The Indian Olympic Association confirmed Meghalaya as the host for the 39th National Games in February/March 2027. Meghalaya will host the event for the first time, aiming to boost sports infrastructure in the Northeast. The 2023 National Games were held in Goa, while Uttarakhand will host the 2025 edition.

question: What is the Highest Common Factor of 23 × 35 and 24 × 36 ?
solution:
(c)
23 × 35 and 24 × 36
HCF = 23 × 35

question:
For what value of K does the following system have an infinite number of solutions?
x + 2Ky - 8 = 0
2x - y - 16 = 0
solution:
(b) x + 2Ky - 8 = 0 …. (i)
2x - y - 16 = 0 ….(ii)
Condition for infinitely many solution , a1a2 = b1b2 = c1c2
By comparing, a1a2 = b1b2
⇒ 12 = 2k-1
⇒ k = - 14

question: The third proportional of x2.5 y 1.5 × Z3.5 and x0.25 × y0.25 z-0.25 is ______.
solution:
(b)

\n

Third proportional = (x0.25 × y0.25z-0.25)2 x2.5 y 1.5 × z3.5 = x12×y12z-12 x52y32× z72
= x12 × y12 × z12x52 × y - 32× z72 = y(12 + 32)x(52 - 12) × z(72 - 12) = y(42)x42 × z(62) = Y2X2Z3

question: Amita can build a room in the same amount of time that Bina and Sita working together can build. If Amita and Bina together could do it in 25 days and Sita alone in 35 days, then how many days are required for Bina alone to do the same work ?
solution:
(b)
Ratio → Amita : Bina + Sita
Time → 1 : 1
Effi. → 1 : 1
Total Effi. = 2 units … (i)
Now,

Effi. of Amita + Bina + Sita = 12 unit … (ii)
From (i) and (ii)
Effi. of Bina and Sita = 6 unit
Effi. of Bina = 6 - 5 = 1 unit
Time taken by Bina = 1751 = 175 days

question: A certain sum of money is lent out at simple interest. If that money becomes ₹24,000 in 2 years and ₹32,000 in 4 years, the annual rate of interest is:
solution:
(b)
Simple interest for 1 year = 32000 - 240002 = 80002 = ₹4000
Principal = 24000 - 2 × 4000 = ₹16000
Hence, rate = 400016000 × 100 = 25%

question: In a class, there are 60 students. The average weight of the entire class is 42 kg. If there are 36 boys in the class and the average weight of all the boys is 50 kg, then what is the average weight (in kg) of all the girls?
solution:
(a)
Total weight of 60 students = 60 × 42 = 2520
Total weight of boys = 36 × 50 = 1800
Total weight of girls = 2520 - 1800 = 720
Average weight of girls = 72024 = 30

question: A reduction of 7.5% in the cost price of a commodity enables a shopkeeper to purchase 15 kg more than what he previously purchased for a sum of ₹7,400. In order to make a profit of 32.5% on the pre-reduction cost price of the commodity, at what price (in ₹) per kg should the commodity be sold ?
solution:
(b)
Expenditure = Price × Consumption
Ratio → Original : Final
Price → 40 : 37
Consumption → 37 : 40
---------------------------------------------------
Expenditure → 1480 : 1480
Increase in quantity (3 units) = 15 kg.
Original consumption (37 units) = 153 × 37 = 185 kg.
The original price of sugar per kg = 7400185 = 40 Rs.
Selling price after 32.5% profit = 40 × 132.5100 = 53

question: Two towns P and Q are 275 km apart. A motorcycle rider starts from P towards Q at 10:00 a.m. at the speed of 25 km/h. Another rider starts from Q towards P at 12 noon on the same day at the speed of 20 km/h. At what time will they cross each other?
solution:
(b)
Distance travelled by P in 2 hour = 50 km
Remaining distance = 275 - 50 = 225
Time taken to meet = 22525 + 20 = 22545 = 5 hours
Hence, they will meet at 5:00 (12 noon + 5 hrs) pm.

question: Which of the following numbers is divisible by 11?
solution:
(c)
For divisibility by 11, the difference between the sum of the digits at odd places and the sum of the digits at even places of the number is either 0 or divisible by 11.
Option (a) 88,65,987
(8 + 6 + 9 + 7) - (8 + 5 + 8) = 30 - 21 = 9 (not divisible by 11)
Option (b) 55,78,961
(5 + 7 + 9 + 1) - (5 + 8 + 6) =22 - 19 = 3 (not divisible by 11)
Option (c) 88,65,747
(8 + 6 + 7 + 7) - (8 + 5 + 4) = 28 - 17 = 11 (divisible by 11)
Option (d) 45,12,458
(4 + 1 + 4 + 8) - (5 + 2 + 5) = 17 - 12 = 5 (not divisible by 11)

question:
Simplify the expression:
15 × 15 × 15 + 3 × 15 × 12 × 12 - 3 × 15 × 15 × 12 - 12 × 12 × 12
solution:
(d)
Concept used :
(a - b)3 = a3 - b3 - 3a2b + 3ab2
15 × 15 × 15 + 3 × 15 × 12 × 12 - 3 × 15 × 15 × 12 - 12 × 12 × 12
153 + 3 × 15 × 122 - 3 × 152 × 12 - 123
= (15 - 12)3 = 33 = 27

question: What is the value of cos(x + y) - sin(x - y) + tan(2z)?
option_1: cos x. cos y - sin x. sin y - sin x. cos y - cos x. sin y + 2 tan z1 - tan2z
option_2: sin x. sin y + 2 tan z1 - tan2z
option_3: cos x.cos y - sin x. sin y - sin x.cos y + cos x. sin y + 2 tan z1 - tan2z
option_4: cos x.cos y - sin x. sin y - cos x. sin y + tan z1 - tan2z
solution:
(c)
As we know
{cos(x + y) = cos x.cos y - sin x. sin y }
{sin(x - y) = sin x.cos y - cos x. sin y}
{tan(2z) = 2 tan z1 - tan2z }
So, cos(x + y) - sin(x - y) + tan(2z)
= cos x.cos y - sin x. sin y - (sin x.cos y - cos x. sin y) + 2 tan z1 - tan2z
= cos x.cos y - sin x. sin y - sin x.cos y + cos x. sin y + 2 tan z1 - tan2z

question: A cylinder has a curved surface area equal to 350% of the curved surface area of another cylinder. If their radii are in the ratio 3 : 1, then the volume of the smaller cylinder is approximately _____% of the larger cylinder (the smaller cylinder has its radius and height smaller when compared to the larger).
solution:
(d)
According to the question,
CSA of the cylinder = 2πrh
2πrh × 350100 = 2πRH
h : H = 6 : 7 (where radii ratio are, 3 : 1)
Volume of the cylinder = πr2h
Small cylinder volume = π12 × 6
Big cylinder volume = π32 × 7
required% = π12 × 6 π32 × 7 × 100 = 9.52%

question:
For which of the following values of a and b do the given equations, have NO solution?
x - ay = 2 - a (1 - a)x + 6y = a + b
solution:
(b)
x - ay = 2 - a
x - ay - (2 - a) = 0 … (i)
(1 - a)x + 6y - (a + b) … (ii)
For No solution
a1a2 = b1b2 ≠ c1c2


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1744607706045.png

question: CD is a tangent to a circle of circumference of 88 cm with its centre at O. OC cuts the circle at P while OD cuts circle at V such that ∠COD = 90°. Length of PC is 6 cm. What is half of CD (in cm) if OD exceeds OC by 1 cm?
solution:
(a)

Circumference of the circle = 2πr
88 = 2 × 227 × r
r = 14 cm
Length of PO and OV = 14 cm
So the length of CO = 6 + 14 = 20 cm
And the length of OD = 20 + 1 = 21
(CD)2 = (CO)2 + (OD)2
(CD)2 = (20)2 + (21)2
(CD)2 = 400 + 441 = 841
CD = 29 cm
Half of the CD = 292 = 14.5 cm


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1744607706277.png

question: Naman bought a few apples for ₹720 from a shop. He negotiated the price and the shopkeeper reduced it by ₹2 per apple. Due to this Naman could buy four more apples than what he had bought earlier. How many apples did he originally buy?
solution:
(c)
Let the initial price of apples be ₹x
According to question
720x-2 - 720x = 4
720(2x(x-2)) = 4
x(x - 2) = 360
x2 - 2x - 360 = 0
x2 - 20x +18x - 360 = 0
x(x - 20) + 18(x - 20) = 0
(x - 20)(x + 18) = 0
⇒ x = 20
the no of apples originally bought = 72020 = 36

question: If cotα = PQ, then find the value of Pcosα - QsinαPcosα + Qsinα - P2 - Q2P2+Q2 + 3.
solution:
(b)
Pcosα - QsinαPcosα + Qsinα
Divide numerator and denominator by sinα
P× cosαsinα - Q× sinαsinαP× cosαsinα + Q× sinαsinα = P × PQ - Q P × PQ+ Q = P2 - Q2P2 + Q2
So, Pcosα - QsinαPcosα + Qsinα - P2 - Q2P2 + Q2 + 3 = P2 - Q2P2 + Q2 -P2 - Q2P2 + Q2 + 3 = 3

question: The population of a city was 5000000 in 2020. The population grows 7.5% annually. The population in 2022 is ______.
solution:
(d)
7.5% = 340
Required population = 5000000 × 4340 × 4340 = 5778125

question: What is the discount that Rohan should offer on the remaining ₹ 8,000 of a laptop priced at ₹ 48,000, given that, he has already given a 12% discount on the first ₹ 28,000 and 8% discount on the next ₹ 12,000 to match the discount amount of 9.5% given on the total price?
solution:
(d)
Overall discount given = 48000 × 9.5% = ₹4560
Discount on first ₹28000 = 28000 × 12% = ₹3360
Discount on next ₹12000 = 12000 × 8% = ₹960
Hence, required discount = 4560 - (3360 + 960) = ₹240

question: PQ is parallel to SR in a trapezium PQRS. It is given that PQ > SR and the diagonals PR and QS intersect at O. If PO = 3x − 15, OQ = x + 9, OR = x − 5 and OS = 5 and x has two values x1 and x2, then the value of (x12 - x22) is:
solution:
(b)
According to the question,

Concept used : - POOR = QOOS
3x-15x-5 = x + 95
15x - 75 = x2 + 9x - 5x - 45
x2 - 11x + 30 = 0
x2 - 6x - 5x + 30 = 0
x(x - 6) - 5(x - 6) = 0
(x - 5)(x - 6)
x = 5, x = 6
Now, the value of (x12 - x22) = (62 - 52) = 36 - 25 = 11

question:
Read the given information and answer the question that follows.
The following table gives the percentage of marks obtained by seven students in six different subjects in an examination.
The number in the brackets give the maximum marks in each subject.

If someone secured all the highest scores that have been obtained by some student or the other in the six subjects as given in the table above, what would be the exact overall percentage score obtained by that student?


https://d2jnyx7x72uicf.cloudfront.net/image_1744607706632.png
solution:
(a)
Highest marks in maths = 150 × 100100 = 150
Highest marks in chemistry = 130 × 80100 = 104
Highest marks in Physics = 120 × 90100 = 108
Highest marks in Geography = 100 × 95100 = 95
Highest marks in History = 60 × 90100 = 54
Highest marks in Computer science = 40 × 90100 = 36
Required percentage = 150 + 104 + 108 + 95 + 54 + 36150 + 130 + 120 + 100 + 60 + 40 × 100
= 547600 × 100 = 5476 = 91 16%

question: In a 5-km race, A beats B by 750 metres and C by 1260 metres. By how many metres does B beat C in the same race?
solution:
(b)
Ratio - A : B : C
Distance - 5km : 4.25km : 3.74km
Now, total distance covered by C in the same race till B finish the race
54.25 × 3.74 = 4.4 km
Hence, distance by which B beats C = 5 - 4.4 = 0.6km = 600 meter.

question: If price of an article increases successively by 15% and 10%, respectively, then what is the percentage equivalent to a single price increase of that article?
solution:
(a)
increase % = 15 + 10 + 15 × 10100 = 26.5%

question: Three partners decided to start a business. They decided to donate 10% of the profit to a charity organisation and then the remaining profit would be shared among first, second and third partner in the ratio 1 : 2 : 2. The total profit received was ₹1,80,000. Find the share of the first partner.
solution:
(a)
Total profit distributed among partners in business = 1,80,000 × 90% = ₹1,62,000
Share of the first partner = (11+ 2 +2) × 1,62,000 = 1,62,0005 = ₹32,400

question: An inlet pipe can fill a water storage tank in 11 hours and an outlet pipe can empty the completely filled tank in 15 hours .If both pipes opened simultaneously. The time taken to fill the empty tank ( in hrs) is :
solution:
(b)

Efficiency of both pipes in 1 hour = 15 - 11 = 4 unitTime taken to fill the tank = 1654 = 4114 hours

question: A boatman rows 2 km in 10 mins, along the stream and 12 km in 2 hours against the stream. What is the speed of the stream ?
solution:
(a)
Downstream speed = 210 × 160 km/h = 12 km/h
Upstream speed = 122 km/h = 6 km/h
Speed of stream = downstream - upstream2 = 12 - 62 = 3 km/h

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence, which contains the grammatical error.
He is in bad mood as he could not clear the exam.
solution:
(b) Bad mood as
There is an article error in the sentence. We will put article ‘a’ before ‘bad mood’ as it is a phrase ‘in a bad mood/situation’. Hence, ‘a bad mood as’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Select the most appropriate Synonym of the given word.
Brat
solution:
(a) Spoilt child
Brat- an ill-mannered annoying child or Spoilt child.
Spoilt child - behaves badly if they do not get what he wants.
Plump lady - having a full rounded shape and slightly fat.
Wise man- having or showing wisdom, good sense, or good judgment.

question:
Identify the best way to improve the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no improvement required, select ‘no improvement’.
The injured man had been shot from his back.
solution:
(a) In the back
There is a prepositional error in the given sentence. The preposition ‘from’ must be replaced with ‘in’ because ‘shot in the back’ is the correct phrase. Hence, ‘in the back’ is the most appropriate answer.

question: Find the correctly spelt word from the given options.
solution: (a) ‘Diesel’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Select the option that correctly expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The shareholders will elect him a director.
option_1: He will be elected as director by the shareholders.
option_2: The shareholders have elected him a director.
solution:
(a) He will be elected as director by the shareholders. (Correct)
(b) The shareholders have elected him a director. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(c) The shareholders elected him a director. (Incorrect Sentence Structure)
(d) He will be elected a director. (Sentence is incomplete)

question:
Identify the segment in the sentence, which contains the grammatical error.
Whom do you think will win the next match and take away the trophy ?
solution:
(a) Whom do
We will replace “Whom”( should be used to refer to the object of a verb or preposition) to “Who” (should be used to refer to the subject of a sentence.) The sentence contains error in option(b).

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) He seemed at first to resent my invasion of his privacy.
(B) But when he found that I did not have a catapult ,he became friendly.
(C) My first friend was a small grey squirrel.
(D) When I started bringing him pieces of cake and biscuit he grew quite bold and was soon taking morsels from hand.
solution:
(d) CABD
Sentence C will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e.a small grey squirrel was the narrator’s friend . Sentence A states that first he thought that it seemed displeased as it thought he invaded its privacy . So, A will follow C. Further, Sentence B states that later it became friendly and Sentence D states that after this he started giving it pieces of cakes and biscuits. So, D will follow B . Going through the options, option (d) has the correct sequence.

question:
Choose the word opposite in meaning to the given word.
Miniature
solution:
(a) Large
Miniature- very small of its kind.
Large- considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.
small- a size that is less than normal or usual.
heavy- to have great weight; difficult to lift or move.
least- smallest in amount, extent, or significance.

question: Identify the word that is misspelt.
solution: (d) ‘Palpable’ is the correct spelling.

question:
Identify the best way to improve the underlined part of the given sentence. If there is no improvement required, select ‘no improvement’.
Mr. A.R. Sahni, member of the Planning Commission said yesterday that five lakh jobs will be created by the year 2023
solution: (d) No improvement. The given sentence is grammatically correct.

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of the underlined idiom.
Despite multiple obstacles, she continued with her endeavour, demonstrating that she has nerves of steel.
option_1: The capacity to maintain composure when stressed
solution: (c) nerves of steel - an absence of fear or anxiety

question:
Select the most appropriate meaning of idiom in the sentence.
Shyam Prasad was a chip off old block.
option_4: someone similar in character to one’s father
solution: (d) someone similar in character to one’s father

question:
Choose the best alternative which best expresses the meaning of the idiom/ phrase given below.
a little gush of gratitude
solution:
(b) A little gush of gratitude- friendly feeling.
She really helped me to set up in the new city, so I owe her a little gush of gratitude.

question:
In the following questions, out of the four alternatives, choose the one which can be substituted for the given words/sentence.
One who has obstinate and narrow religious views
solution:
(b) Bigot- a person who is intolerant towards those holding different opinions.
Theosophist- a person who engages or is an expert in theosophy.
Philosopher- a person engaged or learned in philosophy, especially as an academic discipline.
Theologian- a person who engages or is an expert in theology.

question:
Select the option that expresses the following sentence in active voice.
The letter will be delivered by the postman tomorrow.
option_2: The postman will have delivered the letter tomorrow.
option_3: The postman will deliver the letter tomorrow.
option_4: The postman will be delivering the letter tomorrow.
solution:
(c) The postman will deliver the letter tomorrow. (Correct)
(a) The postman delivered the letter tomorrow. (Incorrect Tense)
(b) The postman will have delivered the letter tomorrow. (Incorrect Verb)
(d) The postman will be delivering the letter tomorrow. (Incorrect Verb)

question:
Select the most appropriate Synonym of the given word
Prodigal
solution:
(b) wasteful
Prodigal- spending money freely and rather wastefully.
Wasteful- using more of something than necessary, causing waste.
Talented- having talent or special ability, gifted.
Intelligent- having or showing the ability to understand, learn and think, clever.
Modest- not talking too much about your own abilities, good qualities, etc.

question:
Select the correct collocation to complete the following sentence.
She suppressed a __________ urge to yawn.
solution:
(b) strong
The given sentence states that she suppressed a strong urge to yawn. Hence, ‘strong’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Given below are four jumbled sentences. Pick the option that gives their correct order.
(A) Reports indicate that thousands of farmers in Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka and Maharashtra have killed themselves, often by drinking pesticide.
(B) What drives farmers, to this extreme step?
(C) The investigation of journalist P. Sainath shows that farmers’ recent distress is due to a fusion of environmental and economic factors.
(D) Agrarian conditions have become more volatile as farmers are exposed to the fluctuations of the world market.
solution:
(b) ABCD
Sentence A will be the starting line as it contains the main idea of the parajumble i.e.thousands of farmers in many states attempted suicide by drinking pesticide. Sentence B asks why the farmers take this step . So, B will follow A. Further, Sentence C states that the investigation showed the main reason of farmers distress is environmental and economic factors and Sentence D states about agrarian conditions . So, D will follow C. Going through the options, option (b) ABCD has the correct sequence.

question:
Choose the word opposite in the meaning to the word given.
Feebleness
solution:
(a) soundness
Feebleness - Lacking bodily strength; weak
Soundness - free from injury, damage, defect, disease, etc. ; in good condition; healthy; robust:
Infirm - not physically or mentally strong, especially through age or illness.
Imbecility - an instance or point of weakness; feebleness; incapability.
Strength - the quality or state of being physically strong.

question: It was difficult to_____ Gopal to watch a horror movie.
solution:
(b) persuade.
Persuade means to make somebody believe something. The given sentence states that it was difficult to make Gopal watch a horror movie. Hence, ‘persuade’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
It was an unusual dark night. In the (96)________ of an enjoyable dream, Jim thought he heard his dog (97)________ loudly. He groaned and glanced (98)________ his clock sleepily. Twelve o'clock the green fluorescent (99)________ of his clock read. Suddenly, Jim (100)________ hushed voices outside his house. He immediately became alert and jumped out of bed. As his parents had gone on a holiday, Jim was alone at home. He decided to look who was outside.
Select the correct option to fill blank 96.
solution:
(a) middle
The phrase ‘in the middle of’ means in the process of doing something. The given passage states that in the middle of an enjoyable dream, Jim thought he heard his dog barking loudly. Hence, ‘middle’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
It was an unusual dark night. In the (96)________ of an enjoyable dream, Jim thought he heard his dog (97)________ loudly. He groaned and glanced (98)________ his clock sleepily. Twelve o'clock the green fluorescent (99)________ of his clock read. Suddenly, Jim (100)________ hushed voices outside his house. He immediately became alert and jumped out of bed. As his parents had gone on a holiday, Jim was alone at home. He decided to look who was outside.
Select the correct option to fill blank 97.
solution:
(b) barking
‘Barking’ is the loud sound made by dogs. The given passage states that in the middle of an enjoyable dream, Jim thought he heard his dog barking loudly. Hence, ‘barking’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
It was an unusual dark night. In the (96)________ of an enjoyable dream, Jim thought he heard his dog (97)________ loudly. He groaned and glanced (98)________ his clock sleepily. Twelve o'clock the green fluorescent (99)________ of his clock read. Suddenly, Jim (100)________ hushed voices outside his house. He immediately became alert and jumped out of bed. As his parents had gone on a holiday, Jim was alone at home. He decided to look who was outside.
Select the correct option to fill blank 98.
solution:
(c) at
‘At’ is a fixed preposition used after the verb ‘glance’. ‘Glance at’ means to take a quick look at something. Hence, ‘at’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
It was an unusual dark night. In the (96)________ of an enjoyable dream, Jim thought he heard his dog (97)________ loudly. He groaned and glanced (98)________ his clock sleepily. Twelve o'clock the green fluorescent (99)________ of his clock read. Suddenly, Jim (100)________ hushed voices outside his house. He immediately became alert and jumped out of bed. As his parents had gone on a holiday, Jim was alone at home. He decided to look who was outside.
Select the correct option to fill blank 99.
solution:
(b) hands
‘Hand’ means a clock’s pointer that indicates time. Hence, ‘hands’ is the most appropriate answer.

question:
Cloze Test:
It was an unusual dark night. In the (96)________ of an enjoyable dream, Jim thought he heard his dog (97)________ loudly. He groaned and glanced (98)________ his clock sleepily. Twelve o'clock the green fluorescent (99)________ of his clock read. Suddenly, Jim (100)________ hushed voices outside his house. He immediately became alert and jumped out of bed. As his parents had gone on a holiday, Jim was alone at home. He decided to look who was outside.
Select the correct option to fill blank 100.
solution:
(b) heard
‘Heard’ is the past form of ‘hear’. The given passage states that Jim heard hushed voices outside his house. Hence, ‘heard’ is the most appropriate answer.
